sentences.en: Dogmatism and empiricism alike are subjectivism, each originating from an opposite pole.
sentences.cn: 教条主义、经验主义,两者都是主观主义, 是从不同的两极发生的东西.

sentences.en: Dogmatism is a malady in the academic research nowadays.
sentences.cn: 摘要“独断论”是当今学术研究的弊病.

sentences.en: Dogmatism is being criticized by various kinds of people.
sentences.cn: 批判教条主义的有各种人.

sentences.en: Dogmatism is puppyish coming to its full growth.
sentences.cn: 教条主义是盲目自高自大的全副面目.

sentences.en: Dogmatism should be criticized, or else many mistakes cannot be rectified.
sentences.cn: 教条主义应当受到批判,不批判教条主义, 许多错事不能改正.

sentences.en: His creation was an antithesis to academic dogmatism of the time.
sentences.cn: 他的创作与当时学院派的教条相对立.

sentences.en: In 1958 he was criticized for dogmatism -- that was unfair.
sentences.cn: 一九五八年批判他搞教条主义, 那是不公正的.

sentences.en: In present circumstances, revisionism is more pernicious than dogmatism.
sentences.cn: 在现在的情况下, 修正主义是比教条主义更有害的东西.

sentences.en: Later, we repudiated dogmatism and came to learn a little more dialectics.
sentences.cn: 后来我们批判了教条主义,逐步地多学会了一点辩证法.

sentences.en: Part Three: The Sino - Russia controversy is representative of pinko dogmatism.
sentences.cn: 第三 部分 、中苏大论战是左倾教条主义的典型.

sentences.en: That is one reason why we have remained opposed to dogmatism toward the theory of Marxism.
sentences.cn: 这就是我们为什么必须始终反对以教条主义的态度对待马克思主义理论的道理所在.

sentences.en: Their chief mistake at the time was dogmatism, transplanting foreign experience mechanically.
sentences.cn: 他们当时的主要错误,就是教条主义, 硬搬外国的经验.

sentences.en: We cannot allow dogmatism to stand in the way of progress.
sentences.cn: 我们不能允许教条主义阻碍进步。

sentences.en: We want to get away from the politics of outdated dogmatism and class confrontation.
sentences.cn: 我们想摒弃过时的教条主义和阶级对抗的政治观点。

sentences.en: When dogmatism turns into its opposite, it becomes either Marxism or revisionism.
sentences.cn: 教条主义走向反面, 或者是马克思主义,或者是修正主义.

words.tran_cn: 教条主义者；独断家；独断论者
把…作为教条阐述；武断地提出

trans.tran_cn: <贬>教条主义，独断论，武断，郑人买履
trans.tran_en: If you refer to an opinion as dogmatism, you are criticizing it for being strongly stated without considering all the relevant facts or other people's opinions
